item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 9th, 2013
item.description:
August 9th, 2013

  • News
    • Google, Mozilla lead web’s mobile renaissance, article (InformationWeek)
    • Persona makes signing in easy for Gmail users, post
    • Mozilla’s Firefox OS phones get operator billing through Bango, article (TechCrunch)
  • UA dev.
    • The first Opera Developer build has been released (analogous to Chrome Canary, Ed.), post
    • Improved window.onerror in Blink, @mikewest’s post
  • FYI
    • Chromestatus.com completely revamped, @ebidel’s post
  • Tutorials
    • Creating dynamic SVG charts with AngularJS data-binding, @kevinrockwood’s post
    • Reactive programming in JavaScript, @alex_young’s post
    • Transforming a jsFiddle into a Firefox OS app, @angelinamagnum’s post
    • CSS live reload with Emmet LiveStyle, @chikuyonok’s post
  • Articles
    • Porting a PhoneGap app to Firefox OS, @andytrice’s post
    • Asm.js is reasonably competitive with native C++ code on ARM, @kannan_vijayan’s post
    • Web design trends in 2013, @CasJam’s post
    • Device communication with ultrasound powered by the Web Audio API, @borismus’s post
  • Media
    • Using the Web Speech API to create voice driven HTML5 games, @HTML5Tyler’s 9-min screencast
    • Tutorial: Writing a native Windows 8.1 app (HTML5 + TypeScript), @AlaShiban’s 17-min screencast
  • Content
    • Git best practices, Seth Robertson’s page
  • Sites
    • appear.in, a simple video meeting service powered by WebRTC, post
  • Tools
    • harp, an open-source web server with built-in pre-processing, site + repo

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 8th, 2013
item.description:
August 8th, 2013

  • W3C
    • CSS Working Group: “Help us name the drag-and-drop pseudo-classes”, survey
  • News
    • Firefox 23 released, release notes + information for developers + coverage (Ars Technica)
    • New release of TodoMVC (new frameworks, Bower integration), @tastejs’s release notes
    • Amazon Appstore now open to web apps, with one-click in-app purchases in tow, article (TechCrunch)
  • UA dev.
    • Feature request: Make cross-origin requests easier to debug in Chrome, source
    • Faster CSS gradients in Firefox Nightly, source
  • FYI
    • With the recent release of Firefox 23, <input type="range"> is finally in all current browsers, source
  • Tutorials
    • Benchmarking web servers with HTTPerf.js and NodeUnit, @mervinej’s post
    • Use cases and patterns for Web Workers (inline, dedicated and shared), @jdcravens’s post
    • Gesture design in mobile web apps with Hammer.js, @inserthtml’s post
  • Articles
    • Autoprefixer - a CSS postprocessor for dealing with vendor prefixes, @andrey_sitnik’s post
    • New features in Bootstrap 3, @AntJanus’s post
    • Data URI performance bottleneck: Is Base64 to blame?, @b1tr0t’s post
  • Media
    • Unit testing: Spying on JavaScript methods with Jasmine, @clemenshelm’s short 6-min screencast
    • REST + JSON APIs in detail, @lhazlewood’s 57-min @JAXconf talk
  • Content
    • Infographic: Evolution of HTML5, page
    • “Pixel perfect timing attacks with HTML5” (white paper), @pdjstone’s 29-page PDF
    • Things can you do with ES6 string template literals, @littlecalculist’s code examples
    • The history of SEO, @HubSpot’s extensive 101-page slide deck
  • Tools
    • Pancake.js, a library for flattening SVG and Canvas elements into images on the fly, repo
    • polyfill.io, a polyfill combinator that selectively polyfills just what the browser needs, repo
  • Opinion
    • Should you review code that you’re not familiar with?, @rmurphey’s post
    • A call to contributors (“We need more amazing community contributors”), @ArleyM’s post

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 7th, 2013
item.description:
August 7th, 2013

  • W3C
    • Updated CR of “HTML5”, TR + diff
    • Updated CR of “HTML Canvas 2D Context”, TR + diff
  • News
    • Petition: “Apple, please support Navigation Timing API in Safari”, page
    • Court in Germany rules that VP8 does not infringe Nokia’s patent, post
    • Does web accessibility really “place ruinous obligations on websites”?, article
  • UA dev.
    • Firefox Nightly talking to Microsoft’s HTTP/2 draft server, source
    • Experimental support for blend modes for SVG in Chromium, @rcabanier’s post
  • Tutorials
    • A terse and easily digestible introductory guide to Grunt, @swapnil_mishra’s post
    • Resizing images on the client-side with HTML5 Canvas, @ttrenka’s post
    • The inherit, initial and unset CSS keywords, @ImpressiveWebs’s post
    • Client-side storage options: Web Storage, Indexed Database, File System et al., @ifandelse’s post
  • Articles
    • Using WebGL to add interactive 3D effects to your website, @glecollinet’s post + cool demo
    • How to choose between a link and a button, @karlgroves’s post
    • 11 JavaScript tools for creating charts and graphs, @inspiretrend’s post w/ screenshots

    • Topic Undefined Ep. 3 (@cfjedimaster/@remotesynth discuss web dev links and news), 34-min podcast

    • A cheat sheet for coding with Emmet, page

    • 21 cool CSS effects for links or menu items, @crnacura’s demo page
    • A 3D cube image gallery, @chinchang457’s demo + tutorial

    • gradientmaps.js, allows you to apply gradient maps to any HTML element on the page, post

    • Annoying trends in modern web design, Corey Siegel’s post

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 6th, 2013
item.description:
August 6th, 2013

  • UA dev.
    • Proposal: Remove Microdata support from WebKit, source
    • An improved DevTools editing workflow: Workspaces, CSS preprocessor mapping and snippets, post
  • FYI

  • Tutorials
    • Learning how to work with PhantomJS on an example, @integralist’s post

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 5th, 2013
item.description:
August 5th, 2013

  • W3C
    • An overview of the first Web Cryptography API implementations, @poulpita’s post

    • Mozilla collaborates with BlackBerry in development of open source security testing platform, article
    • Game developer Arkadium announces support for HTML5 games, article (TechCrunch)
  • UA dev.
    • Vibration API experimentally implemented in Chrome for Android, source
  • FYI
    • The ? key is the de facto standard for displaying the “keyboard shortcuts” dialog in web apps, tweet
  • Tutorials

    • Applying the “atomic design” principle to organize Sass style sheets, @robinrendle’s post

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 2nd, 2013
item.description:
August 2nd, 2013

item.title: Web Platform Daily: August 1st, 2013
item.description:
August 1st, 2013

  • W3C

    • Last week in Blink, @beverloo’s post
    • OCSP stapling has landed in Firefox Nightly, post (Mozilla Security)

  • Tutorials
    • A quick introduction to AngularJS (part 1 of an upcoming series), @ngnewsletter’s post

item.title: Web Platform Daily: July 29th, 2013
item.description:

  • Tutorials
